Name: DivikGlobal
Title: Nice
Review: Entire Janpath gives you the real feel of the Delhi city. From India gate to Rashtrapati Bhawan are large open and green areas that make you feel a bit relaxed. India gate is definitely a must visit place if you are visiting Delhi. For a tourist it has the same importance as that of Arc de Triomphe in Paris.

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Constructed by Edwin Lutyens in Triumphal Style
Review: India gate situated on the eastern side of Raj path. India Gate is memorial built in commemoration of more than 80,000 Indian soldiers who were killed during World War-I between 1914 and 1921. The monument- boasts of its imposing 42 meters high arch and was designed by famous architect Edwin Lutyens in 1921 with Triumphal Architecture style.Interesting facts about India Gate:- on 10th Feb 2021, India gate turned 100 years old- This 42 meter High structure is built in marble with red and pale sandstone- The Corner stone was laid in 1921 by the duke of Connaught, third Son of Queen Victoria. After ten years of planning and construction, it was Finally inaugurated by the then Viceroy of India Sir Lord Irwin on 12th Feb 1931.- An added memorial Amar jawan Jyoti was introduced in 1971 after the Indo-Pak war in the memory of the many deceased Indian Soldiers.- Pragati Maidan Metro Station is nearest metro Station to India GateTimings for Visiting:There are no restricted timings. Any time one can visit but preferable time is in the Evening

Name: podrozniczka60
Title: Magnificent Monument
Review: We visited this place in the days immediately preceding the Republic of India holiday. The route for the annual parade was marked and delineated with tall bleachers for the audience leading via  India Gate.India Gate is arguably most important monument to see in Delhi .

Name: robin k
Title: India Geate
Review: nice and beautiful day in India Gate I was been there many time and I lake to say all the time was good

Name: Bala Krishnapillai
Title: Iconic Indian Gate
Review: The famous India gate . It stands as a memorial to 84,000 soldiers of the British Indian Army who died between 1914 and 1921 in the First World War. You will find a similar structure in Paris (Arc de Triomphe de l'Étoile / Place Charles de Gaulle ) An iconic place to visit in the very early morning to avoid traffic congestion.

Name: Sonia Makhija
Title: Not just a monument
Review: India gate is one of the most touristy attractions of India and Delhi. Remarks as one of the most important monuments to visit and feel the nation’s pride. Indeed its not just a monument or a gate its a feeling of Pride and looks mesmerizing at the time lf Sunrise and Sunset. Though it was much crowded when we visited during evening hours but the area is too big that you’ll definitely get to see an amazing view and get some good pictures. Along with the India Gate visit, you can cover Kartavya Path, Rashtriya Pati bhawan and Netaji Subhash Charndra Bose statue. Hence this is a must to add to your visit to India / Delhi.

Name: Gustavo A
Title: I think the road leading up to the Gate is cooler
Review: It's an arch alright. Not much else to tell about it. It's nice to see but I think the avenue that leads to it from the Rashtrapati Bhavan (presidential residence) is a way nicer attraction. It's wide and very long, reminding us of the avenue from St. James' park leading to Buckingham Palace in London, which is not surprising since it was originally designed by a British man during the British Raj. You can see some hawks flying around too and people just resting on the grass. Do visit in December though, as the weather is sunny but temperate rather than scalding hot as in the summer. Plus, there are fewer people around.

Name: Anika S
Title: Famous Monument at New Delhi .
Review: This historic monument is must see for all - Children, adults ,tourists -from the point of cultural awareness .However during weekends and public holidays ,it can be really crowded .

Name: Todd M
Title: Amazing park and statue
Review: Really cool architecture in the middle of New Delhi. We traveled here the day after Dawali and it was PACKED! Loads of people celebrating and enjoying an evening. Felt very safe as there was a solid police/military presence. Was free to visit and look around.

Name: dr ganapathi bhat
Title: " Nice architecture"
Review: Nice architecture, by the side of the road.  A well planned one. More than one entrance, but exit is from a different gate. An open area, so plenty of light and breeze. People swarm the place like anything. Small hawkers sell tasty eatables inside. A safe place, photography is allowed. No entry fee. May visit once, 30 minutes maximum.

Name: Natalie1204
Title: Gives me goosebumps
Review: I get goosebumps every time I visit. Returned to Delhi after a long time and noticed quite a few changes…for the better. Parking is organised. The food vendors are near the parking area and not in front of the gate. There’s an organised underpass to access the walk area leading up to the gate. Nowadays you can’t walk through but around. The annoying part is the photographers and  jewellery sellers constantly hounding you. There should be a fixed rate if at all. Was very impressed with the garbage atm. Great move

Name: Neelam Rawat
Title: Best in delhi
Review: To visit this place you can choose any Transport options as it's in a VIP area - so metro, cab, bus own vehicle , auto etcYou will easily find parking here, not restaurant but ice cream and chips, soft drinks options are there, you will also find few tea seller there just in case you are tea lover.This place is best for Walk, jogging, and Picknick,Anytime is the best time to visit this place except summer afternoon time as it will be too hot.We have boating options as well but that is only for specific time.Enjoy your visit and please keep every place neat and clean !! Thanks

Name: KodoDrummer
Title: Honouring the Indian soldiers who died fighting in WWI
Review: The amazingly beautiful Indian Gate is surrounded by a well maintained park. It is an iconic symbol of New Delhi. I came across a similar structure called Delhi Gate, which is close to the Red Fort.

Name: Shweta S
Title: Bad behaviour of washroom near parking 2
Review: I use to go the washroom so there were 2 people who are not allowed my wallet purse inside the washroom they ask me to left my wallet ouside the washroom and these people were so rude i asked to check my wallet and it's emergency time to get in but they wouldn't allow me to go and specially the lady was so rude very misbehaved....

Name: singhasam
Title: Impressive memorial.
Review: THIS memorial towering nearly 140ft is a fitting tribute to the 84,000 British Indian Army soldiers who died between 1914 and 1921.It respectfully remembers those who lost their lives in conflicts from the First World War in France to the Near and Far East.Right from the first glimpse of the India Gate it dominates the whole area with presence and feeling.Just walking slowly towards the great arch gives every visitor a feeling of awe and the structure has been compared with that of the Arc de Triomphe in Paris.It was very busy when I visited as part of a combination walk which also took in the nearby National War Memorial.I would recommend visiting both sites at the same time for a full appreciation of what is being remembered.The Gate was designed by the famous architect, Sir Edward Lutyens, and can be reached via the Kartavya Path, the main ceremonial procession route in New Delhi.This stretches some distance and I'd advise anyone tackling that, the Gate and the National War Memorial to ensure they have bottled water with them as there is no cover at the Gate or Path and only a few tree-shaded sections at the Memorial.The whole area is impressive and definitely worth a visit to pay your respects.

Name: Woodstag
Title: Iconic Monument and Gardens in New Delhi
Review: Its a good place to visit in New Delhi because its an iconic monument gardens and park as a tribute to the Indian war dead built in 1931. Great to walk around and near the Parliament.

Name: NVKOnTheGo
Title: Good visit
Review: It is a good place to visit and when we were there we could see lights projected on the monument in changing colours including the proud phase of seeing it lit up in tricolours.

Name: Vinod M
Title: iconic monument
Review: what we tend to forget is that this monument was built in 1931 as a tribute to the fallen indian soldiers who fought for the britishers in world wars and other wars, pre independence.it is very well maintained and now visitors can visit the India Gate.it is iconic and evokes a sense of awe and admiration. there are beautiful gardens adjacent to this monument.a wonderful piece of indian history. Also it looks awesome in the evening when it is lit up by lighting.

Name: Nisarg S
Title: Iconic Delhi Monument
Review: The most iconic monument of New Delhi. It’s quite great after the central vista revamp. A must visit if you’re in Delhi for a day.

Name: ianwyj
Title: Then-closed to visitors...now reopened
Review: I was hoping to visit India Gate on a recent trip but the area had been cordoned off for quite a long time for renovations to the central vista area, and traffic barriers prevented entry of all visitors.  At least until recently when the area was reopened to the public.  Unfortunately, all I managed to get was a quick photo of the this forty-metre tall, Lutyens-designed memorial to India's fallen troops of the first world war from some distance.

Name: shubhamoys
Title: India Gate
Review: Beautiful monument. Overall India gate along with Kartavya path- is a must visit place in Delhi. The monument looks even better in the evening.

Title: Latest Hindi News - Breaking News in Hindi, Hindi Khabar | Khabar India

Name: pragati9
Title: Avoid going around independence month.
Review: If independence day is around the corner then visitors are not allowed close to India Gate.If you are first time visitors then do go, but if repeat visitors then take your call.Only one or two gates are open.Amar Jyothi complex is open .Cleanliness is maintained and guards  try to keep people organized.

Title: Should visit India Gate

I would definitely visit this place again to feel that vibe by seeing it very closely. Mask is mandatory in and around this area. I stopped the car for a min to click a picture but still we were asked to leave by police.

Name: Sushriit Chatterjee
Title: India Gate - The All India War Memorial.
Review: India Gate has been abuzz with people from all over the city. The experience of visiting the All India War Memorial , popularly known as  The India Gate , is located along the Rajpath in new Delhi. It stands as a memorial to 90,000 soldiers of the British Indian Army who died in  between 1914 and 1921 in the First World War. This 42-meter tall historical structure was designed by Sir Edwin Lutyens, the gate evokes the architectural style of the triumphal arch such as the Arch Of Constantine, in Rome, and is often compared to the Gateway Of India, Mumbai. India Gate is also famous for hosting the Republic Day Parade every year.

Name: Shubham K
Title: Must visit place for aspiring soldiers or police officers

You will find a very large space to explore and chill in the garden covering the entire area.4. India Gate is best experienced at the night with families, group hangouts, and solo as well.5. Access to India Gate is easy via public and private transport.6. Pro Tip - Beware of overcharging for rickshaws/auto etc.

Name: Nikita Yadav
Title: the gate of pride
Review: the india gate is the historic monument situated in the capital of india i.e delhi. india gate is the monument on which the names of all the soldiers who gained martyrdom have been inscribed and at every independence day and republic day the lamp is lit at this place. moreover there is the amar jawan jyoti near it which is a lamp that is lighting right since the time india gained independence in 1947. it remarks the peace and integrity of the country. also the beautiful ambience around the place makes it a tourist attraction as you can enjoy the weather be it a sunny afternoon, a dewful morning or a rainy evening.

India gate look great in night time due to lighting, spend quality time with your loved ones but please please request you to do not spoil the place by throwing rapers and unnecessary garbage on road.

Name: Tapanmc
Title: Respect to the Fallen
Review: India Gate is a war memrial to commemorate thesacrifice of Indian soldiers  in 1st WW and third Anglo Afgan war war . It was designed by Sir Edwin Tltyens .It is located astride Rajpoth of New Delhi .Afer 1971 war with Pakistan anotherstructure was made beneath the arch with black marble plinth with rifle planted riverse style and a helmet on butt,a traditional sign of military condololence .A smart team of army is posted there . All around the arch there is a small garden . People can freely take picture of the arch. It reminds the visitor soldiers sacrificed their life  so that his country men can live in peace and dignity.
